meanings.definition: To cause pain or harm to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The bully was inflicting pain on the smaller kids.
meanings.sent2: The criminal was inflicting harm on innocent victims.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten kept inflicting scratches on the furniture.
meanings.sent4: The storm was inflicting its wrath on the coastal town.
meanings.sent5: The dentist's drill sounded like it was inflicting torture.

meanings.definition: To impose something unwelcome or harmful on someone.
meanings.sent1: The strict teacher was inflicting strict rules on the students.
meanings.sent2: The company was inflicting layoffs on its employees.
meanings.sent3: The prankster kept inflicting surprises on his friends.
meanings.sent4: The bad weather was inflicting chaos on the outdoor event.
meanings.sent5: The virus was inflicting havoc on the computer system.

meanings.definition: To bring about or impose something unpleasant or harmful.
meanings.sent1: The chef was inflicting a burnt taste on the dish.
meanings.sent2: The new policy was inflicting confusion on the employees.
meanings.sent3: The magician kept inflicting laughter on the audience.
meanings.sent4: The gossip was inflicting damage on relationships.
meanings.sent5: The curse was inflicting misery on the kingdom.
